GlooKit.GlooFramework

Class Modal

  • java.lang.Object
    • GlooKit.GlooFramework.KitBit
      • GlooKit.GlooFramework.Nook
        • GlooKit.GlooFramework.Modal

  • public class Modal
extends Nook
    A Modal is a Nook that disappears when it is clicked off of. They are identical to Nooks, except that they override the checkFocus(Input) method of KitBit to call the destroy() method when a click occurs but this Modal is not under the mouse.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Nook

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkFocus(Input input)
      Overrides the default checkFocus(Input) method of KitBit to close this Modal if a click occurs when this Modal is active and the click happens somewhere other than the Modal.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Modal

        public Modal(int X,
             int Y,
             java.lang.String W,
             java.lang.String H,
             GlooApplication app,
             KitBit... children)
        Constructs a Modal with the exact same parameters as a Nook.
        Parameters:
        X - int of the horizontal justification, as defined in the KitBit class
        Y - int of the vertical justification, as defined in the KitBit class
        W - a valid formatting String for setting the width, as defined in the KitBit class
        H - a valid formatting String for setting the height, as defined in the KitBit class
        app - the GlooApplication of this Modal, which allows Modal to capture input
        children - possibly many KitBits, which are children of this Modal. Can take any number of KitBits (null for none)
        See Also:
        Nook.Nook(int, int, String, String, GlooApplication, KitBit...)

    • Method Detail

      • checkFocus

        public boolean checkFocus(Input input)
        Overrides the default checkFocus(Input) method of KitBit to close this Modal if a click occurs when this Modal is active and the click happens somewhere other than the Modal.
        Overrides:
        checkFocus in class KitBit
        Parameters:
        input - an Input, which handles user input from keyboards, mice and controllers and is typically passed down by the parent of this KitBit
        Returns:
        true if this KitBit is in focus
